title: JPAStreamer - Express Hibernate Queries as Standard Java Streams

labels.name: area/quarkiverse
labels.description: This issue/PR is part of the Quarkiverse organization

body:
### Description

[JPAStreamer]([www.jpastreamer.org](http://www.jpastreamer.org/)) is a lightweight open-source extension for applications adhering to the JPA standard that enriches the API to support Java Stream queries. A Quarkus extension would bring these streaming capabilities to Quarkus Hibernate applications and other JPA providers, facilitating type-safe queries and thus allowing the use of code-completion and improving code quality.

Here is an example of a query for a Film database that returns the ten shortest films with a title that starts with the letter “A”:

```
JPAStreamer jpaStreamer = JPAStreamer.of("sakila") 
jpaStreamer.stream(Film.class)
    .filter(Film$.title.startsWith("A")) <1>          // WHERE
    .sorted(Film$.length)                             // ORDER BY 
    .skip(0)                                          // OFFSET
    .limit(10);                                       // LIMIT
```

<1> Film$ is automatically generated by JPAStreamer from the JPA Entity Film at build time.

So how is this different from using Hibernate's stream method, followed by the same Stream pipeline? Upon execution, JPAStreamer translates the Stream pipeline operations to a JPA query. Thus only the rows of interest are fetched from the database because the following query would be executed:

```
from
     film film0_ 
where
     film0_.title like ? 
order by
     film0_.length asc 
limit ?, ?
```
